notesStmt.note: Hebrew inscriptions partially illegible (folios 2r, 2v). Ḥayim of Moriali ben Yaʿaḳov owner: sold to Shelomoh Yedayah(?) in 164 [1404]: purchase note (634r). Shelomoh ben Ḥayim sold it to Menaḥem ben Yeḥiel on Tuesday, 4 Tishri 168 [1408]: purchase note (634r). Ḥananel Menaḥem Yedayah(?) ben Yeḥiel: sold to Yaʿaḳov ben Eliʿezer on Wednesday 13 Tishri, 191 [1430]: purchase note (634r). Yaʿaḳov ben Eliʿezer sold it to Eleʿazar bar Shemuʾel ha-Leṿi on Thursday 24 Tishri, 191 [1430]: purchase note (634r). Molin (?) Montneier's widow: sold through Meʾir ben Yitsḥaḳ: purchase note (15th century) (634r). Yisraʾel ben Meʾir Heilpron (Heilbronn?): sold to Yosef ben Shelomoh: purchase note (15th century) (634r). Shelomoh bar Yosef Ḳastel Virnaḳo (?), Rikha Luriah: inscribed with their names (16th century?) (3r). Yaʿaḳov Ṿiṭal: inscribed with his name (17th century?) (2r). Yoʾel Abram Luzzatto [..] di Cittadella: inscribed with his name in Italian (1r). Abraham Luzzattoowner and his wife Perla: inscribed with their names, 433 [1673] (2r).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch, the Five Scrolls and Hafṭarot with masorah and Rashi's commentary.

collation.p: 73 quires: i10 (folios 1-10), ii-ix8 (11-74), x10 (75-84), xi-xiv8 (85-116), xv12 (117-128), xvi8 (129-136), xvii12 (137-148), xviii8 (149-156), xix8 (157-164), xx12 (165-176), xxi8 (177-184), xxii10 (185-194), xxiii8 (195-202), xxiv10 (203-212), xxv-xxvii8 (213-236), xxviii-xxx12 (237-272), xxxi6 (273-278), xxxii-xxxix8 (279-342), xl-xli10 (343-362), xlii-xlvi8 (363-402), xlvii12 (403-414), xlviii8 (415-422), xlix10 (423-432), l16 (433-448), li-lii12 (449-472), liii8 (473-480), liv14 (481-494), lv10 (495-504), lvi-lviii8 (505-528), lix4 (529-532), lx-lxv8 (533-580), lxvi6 (581-586), lxvii-lxviii14 (587-614), lxix6 (615-619a), lxx-lxi6 (620-631), lxxii-lxxiii3 (632-637). Catchwords. From folio 601r onwards, due to the tight binding and the lack of catchwords, the collation cannot be established with certainty. It is clear, however, that there were some changes over time in the sequence of the folios. The prints of the text on folio 632 can be seen on the verso side of folio 619a, thus folios 635r-631v was inserted in between later. The last folio of the codex was 634, folios 635r-637v are later additions.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script, punctuated. Mordekhai Emendante, punctuator and scribe of the masorah: inscribed with his name (104v, 344v); the name Mordechai is decorated (). Ḥayim de-Ḳofdana of ?: inscribed with his name (folios 111r, 633r). The word ḥayim is decorated (folio 111r).

decoDesc.decoNote: 340r2 diagrams of the Land of Canaan and its neighbours in ink.
341r2 diagrams of the Land of Canaan and its neighbours in ink.
Numerous initial-word panels with gold letters, decorated with foliate motifs in colours or filigree penwork, or inhabited by dragons and hybrids in colours.

Commentary in geometric forms or in medallions.
